description: Timeline of articles, posts, and related misinformation surrounding the Connor Reed case (Jan–Apr 2020). Each entry includes date, outlet, author, headline, classification, trust metrics, and mapped filenames.

events.author: WHO Press Office
events.headline: Recommendations to reduce risk of transmission of emerging pathogens

events.headline: HOT TODDY ‘REMEDY’ Coronavirus UK – First Brit known to catch virus ‘beat deadly flu with glass of hot whisky and honey’
events.description: Sensationalised reporting implying whisky and honey cured COVID-19.

events.author: Lee Brown
events.headline: UK teacher claims he beat coronavirus with ‘hot whisky and honey’
events.description: Amplified The Sun’s original claim internationally.

events.author: Mari Jones
events.headline: Coronavirus victim from North Wales thought to be first UK national to contract killer disease
events.description: Local factual reporting confirming Connor Reed’s identity and background.

events.headline: Connor Reed who caught coronavirus thought he had bad case of flu
events.description: Follow-up interview correcting national reporting errors.
